perturbation.original_text: LIMITATIONS. NETGEAR has no liability to Distributor under this section entitled CLAIMS OF INFRINGEMENT with respect to any claim which is based upon or results from (i) the combination of any Product with any equipment, device, firmware or software not furnished by NETGEAR, or (ii) any modification of any Product by a party other than NETGEAR. (iii) Distributor's failure to install or have installed changes, revisions or updates as instructed by NETGEAR, or (iv) NETGEAR's compliance with Distributor's or end-user's specifications, designs or instructions.
perturbation.changed_text: LIMITATIONS. NETGEAR has no liability to Distributor under this section entitled CLAIMS OF INFRINGEMENT with respect to any claim which is based upon or results from (i) the combination of any Product with any equipment, device, firmware or software not furnished by NETGEAR, (ii) any modification of any Product by a party other than NETGEAR (iii) Distributor's failure to install changes, revisions or updates as instructed by NETGEAR, or (iv) NETGEAR's compliance with Distributor's or end-user's specifications, designs or instructions, unless mutually agreed in writing.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'unless mutually agreed in writing' to the Limitations clause introduces a contradiction. The original clause establishes clear limitations on NETGEAR's liability, while the added phrase allows for exceptions based on mutual agreement. This undermines the defined limitations, creating ambiguity and potential disputes over liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Clear and Unambiguous Terms

perturbation.original_text: NETGEAR agrees to indemnify Distributor against any claim arising out of or resulting from the Products or the Agreement, provided that any such claim (i) is attributable to bodily injury, death, or to injury to or destruction of physical property (other than the Products), and (ii) is caused by the negligent act or omission of NETGEAR or a material defect in the Product.
perturbation.changed_text: NETGEAR agrees to indemnify Distributor against any claim arising out of or resulting from the Products or the Agreement, provided that any such claim (i) is attributable to bodily injury, death, or to injury to or destruction of physical property (other than the Products), and (ii) is caused by the negligent act or omission of NETGEAR or a material defect in the Product, provided it does not exceed $100.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'provided it does not exceed $100' after setting up conditions introduces a contradiction. The original clause establishes clear conditions for NETGEAR's agreement to defend liability claims, while the added phrase creates a contradiction by allowing exceptions based on maximum limits and potential disputes over liability. This undermines the defined conditions, creating ambiguity and potential disputes over liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Clear and Unambiguous Terms

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may be canceled at any time without cause, by either party upon ninety (90) days written notice to the other party.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be canceled at any time without cause, by either party upon ninety (90) days written notice to the other party, unless unforeseen circumstances arises.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'unless unforeseen circumstances arises' after setting up how to cancel Agreement introduces a contradiction. The original clause establishes clear conditions for NETGEAR's agreement to defend liability claims, while the added phrase creates a contradiction by allowing exceptions based on maximum limits and potential disputes over liability. This undermines the defined conditions, creating ambiguity and potential disputes over liability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Clear and Unambiguous Terms
